transcript_segments.text: Greetings to everyone

We’re going to see how to make a biryani using Seeraga Samba rice and masala. It’s called Dindigul Chicken Biryani. I’ve explained everything step-by-step in this video, so be sure to watch the whole video.

For this, I’ve taken 750 grams of chicken with bone, cut into small pieces and kept ready. I’ve washed 1 kg of Seeraga Samba rice twice and soaked it. Now, we’ll prepare the masala first, starting with a ground paste.

instruction: Soak the washed rice in water for 20–30 minutes. This helps it cook evenly and absorb flavors better.
title: Soak the Rice

instruction: In a bowl, mix curd, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, black pepper powder, and salt.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: You can put everything in a mixer jar: about 12 green chilies, 5 small pieces of ginger, garlic cloves — grind it all with a little water. Next, let’s make a spice powder: about 12 cardamoms, 10 cloves, 3 pieces of cinnamon, 5–7 mace strands…
Add all of that to a mixer jar along with half a piece of nutmeg, 3 bay leaves, about 10 black stone flowers (kalpasi). Grind everything well into a biryani masala powder and keep it aside.
We need to sauté everything well in oil until the raw smell goes away. Add 1/4 tsp of turmeric powder. Since the onion is ground raw, the raw smell will still be there — sauté it well to remove that.
After it’s sautéed well like this, add 1 tbsp red chili powder, 6 tbsp cumin powder, and 1 tbsp coriander powder.

instruction: Add the mutton or chicken to the marinade and coat well. Let it rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
title: Marinate the Meat

transcript_segments.text: After it’s sautéed well like this, add 1 tbsp red chili powder, 6 tbsp cumin powder, and 1 tbsp coriander powder.

instruction: Add fennel seeds, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, and star anise. Fry until aromatic (about 30 seconds).

instruction: Mix in mint leaves and coriander leaves. Cook for another 1–2 minutes until wilted and fragrant.
title: Add Fresh Herbs

transcript_segments.text: Next, add salt as needed and sauté all the masalas thoroughly. Then add about 350 ml of curd and cook well with the masala. Add a handful of chopped coriander and mint leaves.

instruction: Transfer the marinated meat into the pot. Stir well to combine with the masala base.
title: Add Marinated Meat

transcript_segments.text: Now add the marinated chicken (cut with bone). Add the 750g chicken to the masala and sauté it well until the masala coats the chicken. Cover and cook.

instruction: Cook the meat on medium heat until it's partially cooked and the masala is thick and clings to the meat.
title: Cook the Meat

transcript_segments.text: Now add the marinated chicken (cut with bone). Add the 750g chicken to the masala and sauté it well until the masala coats the chicken. Cover and cook.

instruction: Add 3 1/2 cups of water to the pot. Stir and bring it to a boil over high heat.
title: Pour Water

transcript_segments.text: Once it's half cooked, squeeze in juice from 2 large or 3 small lemons. This adds a nice tangy flavor and balances the taste.
After adding lemon juice, add another handful of coriander and mint. Then add 1 liter of water (for 1 kg of rice). This ratio is perfect for cooking the chicken and balancing the gravy consistency.
Once the water comes to a boil, add the soaked Seeraga Samba rice. We are going to cook this on dum (steam). Stir occasionally; otherwise, the rice might stick to the bottom.

Keep stirring now and then. Then close the lid and don’t leave it open for too long. Otherwise, the water will evaporate and there won't be enough moisture. So keep it closed and cook on dum, checking occasionally.

instruction: Taste and adjust salt as needed. The water should taste slightly salty at this stage.

Now we’ll put it on dum (steam cooking). I’ve kept a tawa (griddle) heated separately. Place the biryani pot on top of it. For the first 6–7 minutes, cook on high flame so that steam builds up properly inside.

instruction: Drain the soaked rice completely and gently add it to the pot with the meat and broth.
title: Drain and Add Rice

transcript_segments.text: Let it steam for 15 minutes. After that, turn off the stove and let it rest for 15 more minutes. Don’t open immediately, or the rice won’t fluff up properly. Resting helps the rice settle and become soft.
